title: Reaction to Trump’s Racist Post Shows He Is Not Always Immune to Politics
summary: With the midterm elections nearing, President Trump has found himself in the uncomfortable position of backtracking, even if only by degrees, at key moments.

title: Fake Post About Racist Video Looked to Be Trump’s on Truth Social
summary: The post, which spread widely, appeared to describe the president’s rationale for deleting a racist video about the Obamas that he had shared.

title: Binance Gives Trump Family’s Crypto Firm a Leg Up
summary: Ties between the exchange and the president’s company, World Liberty Financial, have only strengthened since the president pardoned Binance’s founder, Changpeng Zhao.

title: Files Detail Epstein’s Dealings With Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick
summary: Mr. Lutnick had claimed to have distanced himself from Jeffrey Epstein even before the disgraced financier was convicted of a sex crime in Florida.

title: Washington Post C.E.O. Will Lewis Steps Down After Stormy Tenure
summary: His departure came days after the company cut 30 percent of the staff. He will be replaced in the interim by Jeff D’Onofrio, the chief financial officer, the company said.

title: Top ICE Lawyer in Minnesota Departs as Immigration Lawsuits Overwhelm Courts
summary: Jim Stolley, the chief counsel for U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement in Minnesota, has left as government prosecutors grapple with a crush of cases.

title: A Month After Renee Good’s Killing, Her Partner Makes First Public Appearance at Memorial
summary: Becca Good attended a memorial for Renee Good, offering words of compassion and resilience to the crowd gathered in a snow-covered Minneapolis park.

title: At Least 50 Arrested After Protests Escalate Outside Minnesota Federal Building
summary: The Whipple Federal Building has become both a staging ground for immigration agents and a hub for demonstrations against the crackdown in the Twin Cities.

title: A Super Bowl in Silicon Valley Filled With Valley Billionaires
summary: A who’s who of celebrities will join them. Just a little over 25 percent of the seats for the game will be for regular fans, with the cheapest ticket now selling for more than $4,000.

title: Thousands in Mississippi Remain Without Power Two Weeks After Winter Storm
summary: A majority of those who lost service have had their power restored. But thousands in more rural areas remain in darkness, according to a local utility.

title: NYC Is Still Covered in Grimy Snow and Ice. Will It Ever Melt?
summary: Ah, those first wondrous hours of a snowstorm in New York. Two weeks later, the sidewalks are sooty and treacherous, and the parked cars are frozen in surrender.

title: What to Know About the Cold Snap in NYC This Weekend
summary: Cold-weary New Yorkers will get hit by another blast of frigid weather. Here’s what to expect, and what the city is doing to protect the vulnerable.

title: The Demise of U.S.A.I.D. Was a Warning
summary: The brutality of U.S.A.I.D.’s closure and the disregard for the human toll betrayed a vision of a crueler, meaner, more insular world.

title: Ultraprocessed, Industrial Food Is Fine
summary: We can’t feed 340 million Americans with local, organic and low-tech dishes.

title: Savannah Guthrie, in New Video, Promises to Pay for Her Mother’s Return
summary: The “Today” show anchor, in a message on social media with her siblings, said the return of their mother Nancy “is the only way we will have peace.”

title: In Bid to Lead Thailand, a Progressive Party Softens Its Image
summary: Sunday’s election is a test for the progressive, pro-democracy movement in Thailand, which has been blocked from taking power despite success at the polls.

title: Brad Arnold, Rocker Who Fronted 3 Doors Down, Dies at 47
summary: He wrote the band’s breakout hit, “Kryptonite,” in a high school math class, and would go on to be nominated for three Grammy Awards.

title: Japan’s Leader Makes a Bold Election Bet. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Sanae Takaichi, who has proved popular as the first woman to lead Japan as prime minister, hopes to bolster her power in a snap election. But she faces hurdles.
